intro: Galium lucidum var. meliodorum, commonly known as the shining bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. Its leaves and flowers are often covered in a waxy coating, giving it a shiny appearance.
